slick.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if something is slick, it is done in a skilful and attractive way and seems expensive, but it often contains no important or interesting ideas
slick.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if someone is slick, they are good at persuading people, often in a way that does not seem honest
slick.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He got round the defender using some slick footwork.
slick.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Cars were sliding off roads that were slick with rain.
slick.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an area of oil on the surface of water or on a road
slick.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a magazine printed on good-quality paper with a shiny surface, usually with a lot of colour pictures
slick.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a smooth car tyre used for racing
slick.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a slick person uses clever talk to persuade people to do something, especially in a way that does not seem honest or sincere
slick.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The public sometimes view the salesperson as being a slick fast-talking confidence trickster.
slick.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: cleverly made and attractive, but often not containing any important or interesting ideas
slick.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The agency has a reputation for producing work that is slick and classy.
